tabs.title: Introduction
tabs.content:
“Creativity is intelligence having fun”

– Albert Einstein

Ever thought why a computer program should always be functional? Wondered how amazing it would be if we can bring out and showcase our creativity through coding? If yes, then this is the platform for you.

Here is an ultimate opportunity to all those prodigal brains with creative prowess. Draw wings to your ideas and make them flutter and fly in the horizon of Creative Coding. Not limited to just computer geeks and hardcore programmers, this workshop is meant for all those untiringly creative minds with unimaginable ideas, ranging from a musician or an architect, to a mechanic or an artist.

tabs.title: Guest Profile
tabs.content:
Gene Kogan:

Gene Kogan is an avant-garde programmer and a creative artist, who vouches for creative solution through code. The application of emerging technology into artistic and expressive contexts is his primary forte. He is a contributor to openFrameworks, Processing and p5.js and an Adjunct professor at Bennington College, Vermont, USA and an artist in residence at Eyebeam. His own artistic output is a characterised by inquiries into the grey areas of computational intelligence, and the application of machine learning to control generative and parametric systems.

Some of his talks and presentations include ‘Carnival if e-Creativity’ in Uttarakhand, ‘Generative systems’ for design at Microsoft Research Centre, Bangalore, ‘Code as Expression Communication and Collaboration’ in Brooklyn, New York, et al. Apart from generative arts, he has done several projects, of which Robot Shakespeare- an automatic bot that tweets modern versions of Shakespeare himself, Listening to the Ocean – a technique that uses algorithms to create various types of seashells by gypsum powder are a few to mention.

Profile: https://www.linkedin.com/in/gene-kogan-8234b51

tabs.title: Agenda
tabs.content:
Day 1

» About the guest

» What is creative coding?

» History, artists, work examples

» Projects, research interests, resources, organizations

» Processing 101

» Getting started with creative coding using processing

» Basic graphics, sound

» Interactivity

» Computer vision

» Basic CV programming

» Reasons to do computer vision

» Tracking people, interactive spaces, cameras

» Working with sound

» Audio reactivity

Day 2

» Presentation of more recent works

» p5.js

» Goals of new version of processing

» Working in the browser

» Server/client type programming

» Modern day problems

» Machine learning

» Academics vs artists

» Open source culture

» Learning to learn

» Online resources

» How to deal with unexpected technical problems

» What makes a problem interesting and how to begin answering it

tabs.title: Rules
tabs.content:
» Eligibility Criterion:

Students having valid IDs from any recognized educational institution can attend this workshop.

» Pre-requisites:

There are no pre-requisites. However, an interest or background in programming is beneficial.

» Type of Participation:

Participants have to register individually for this workshop. They can be from any discipline.

» Payment:

Registration fee for the workshop is â‚¹1500 per head and the payment details will be mailed to the shortlisted participants.

» Certificate Criterion:

The certificate will be issued to the participant only if he/she attends all the sessions of the workshop. Failing to do so, the registration of the participant will stand for the cancellation and he/she will have to forfeit the fee.

tabs.title: FAQ
tabs.content:
» What do I gain from this workshop?

You gain an understanding about Creative Coding which would enhance your coding skills.

» Do I require any special skill-set to attend the workshop?

All you require is your interest. We prefer you coming with an open mind. 

» Will I be provided with a certificate?

Yes, but we request you to participate for your own interest and not for a certificate.

» Should I bring any material for this workshop?

You must bring your College ID card. If you are required to bring anything else, we would inform you through mail after your registration.

» Do you provide accommodation?

Yes. The short listed candidates will be provided accommodation based on the availability and nativity. Participants have to separately register and pay for the accommodation. Participants will be notified of the registrations for accommodation.
